**Text:**

"Oh, how delightful," I muttered under my breath, sarcasm dripping like venom as I laid eyes on that blasted mug. Still there, perched prominently beside mine, as if it hadn't been banished along with its owner. A chipped lip and faded logo were the only signs of its age, much like the memories etched into my mind.

I snatched it up, fingers tightening around the cool ceramic. It felt wrong, dirty even, to hold something he once touched. "As if a simple mug could hold any sentimental value," I scoffed internally, discarding it with unnecessary force into the trash can. The smash was cathartic, but not nearly enough to drown out the echoes of his laughter that still lingered in this godforsaken break room.

"Let's celebrate, shall we?" I said aloud to no one, pulling down my favorite mug - mine, not ours - and pouring myself a steaming cup of coffee. The aroma should have been comforting, but all I could think was, "What's the point? It'll only end up bitter in the end." I took a sip, grimacing at the taste. "Just like everything else," I thought, turning away from the shelf and leaving the shattered pieces behind.
